message.content:
cs.AR, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.SY, cs.NE 

This paper discusses the design of specialized hardware for training deep convolutional neural networks, which is a topic that falls under the intersection of several computer science subfields. The paper specifically focuses on the design of a communication network for heterogeneous manycore systems, which suggests that the paper is likely to be categorized under cs.AR (Hardware Architecture), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.CV (Computer Vision), cs.SY (Systems and Control), and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Among these categories, cs.AR and cs.AI are the most likely since the paper discusses the design of specialized hardware for neural network training, while cs.CV is also likely since the paper focuses on image classification tasks. The paper also discusses the performance and energy efficiency of the proposed hardware, which suggests that it could be categorized under cs.SY and cs.NE as well.
